import { Playground } from 'docz';
import { useState } from 'react';

import ReactGlobe from './ReactGlobe';

# Focus

## Behavior

To focus on a specific lat-long coordinate (e.g. Singapore `[1.3521, 103.8198]`), pass an array of coordinates to the component. Clicking on the globe or resetting the `focus` prop to `undefined` unfocuses the globe.

<Playground>
  {() => {
    const [focus, setFocus] = useState(undefined);
    return (
      <div>
        <button onClick={() => setFocus([1.3521, 103.8198])}>Singapore</button>
        <button onClick={() => setFocus([40.73061, -73.935242])}>
          New York
        </button>
        <button onClick={() => setFocus([37.773972, -122.431297])}>
          San Fransisco
        </button>
        <button onClick={() => setFocus(undefined)}>None</button>
        <ReactGlobe focus={focus} />
      </div>
    );
  }}
</Playground>

## `FocusOptions`

Use the `FocusOptions` to control how focused coordinates behave. You can pass any number of option fields. Default options can be imported from the module with:

```js
import { defaultFocusOptions } from 'react-globe';
```

Use the playground code editor to explore customizing the focus animations or disabling the defocus feature.

<Playground>
  {() => {
    const [focus, setFocus] = useState(undefined);
    return (
      <div>
        <button onClick={() => setFocus([1.3521, 103.8198])}>Singapore</button>
        <button onClick={() => setFocus([40.73061, -73.935242])}>
          New York
        </button>
        <button onClick={() => setFocus([37.773972, -122.431297])}>
          San Fransisco
        </button>
        <button onClick={() => setFocus(undefined)}>None</button>
        <ReactGlobe
          focus={focus}
          focusOptions={{
            animationDuration: 3000,
            distanceRadiusScale: 2,
            easingFunction: ['Elastic', 'In'],
            enableDefocus: false,
          }}
        />
      </div>
    );
  }}
</Playground>
